intro: Guarea humaitensis, commonly known as the yellow spondias, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and elongated, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by fruit that turns from green to yellow or red when mature. Its wood is durable and has been used traditionally for construction and tool-making. The species also plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
